description.summary: describe and manage toplevel state

protocol.description:
The purpose of the interfaces in this protocol is to describe and potentially allow management of the state of a foreign toplevel.
This protocol depends on the ext-foreign-toplevel-list protocol.
The compositor may choose to restrict this protocol to a special client launched by the compositor itself or expose it to all clients, this is compositor policy.
The key words "must", "must not", "required", "shall", "shall not", "should", "should not", "recommended", "may", and "optional" in this document are to be interpreted as described in IETF RFC 2119.
Warning! The protocol described in this file is currently in the testing phase. Backward compatible changes may be added together with the corresponding interface version bump. Backward incompatible changes can only be done by creating a new major version of the extension.

interface.name: ext_foreign_toplevel_state_manager_v1

description.summary: describe toplevel state

interface.description: The global object used to initialize the extension interfaces to get updates to the state of a toplevel.

event.name: capabilities

description.summary: compositor capabilities

event.description:
This event advertises the capabilities supported by the compositor. If a capability isn't supported, clients should hide or disable the UI elements that visualize the corresponding states or actions. E.g. if maximizing isn't supported, a taskbar might not show a corresponding button in its context menu.
Compositors must send this event once after creation of an ext_foreign_toplevel_state_v1. When the capabilities change, compositors must send this event again.

enum.name: error

description.summary: ext_foreign_toplevel_state_v1 errors

enum.description: These errors are sent in response to ext_foreign_toplevel_state_v1 requests.

entry.name: already_constructed
entry.summary: the ext_foreign_toplevel_state_handle_v1 was already constructed for the specified ext_foreign_toplevel_handle_v1 object

request.name: destroy

description.summary: destroy the ext_foreign_toplevel_state_v1 object

request.description:
Destroys the ext_foreign_toplevel_state_v1 object.
This does not affect any existing ext_foreign_toplevel_state_handle_v1 objects.

request.name: get_state_handle

description.summary: create the object for toplevel state updates

request.description:
This request creates an extension object to receive state updates for the foreign toplevel.
It is illegal to destroy the ext_foreign_toplevel_handle_v1 before the ext_foreign_toplevel_state_handle_v1 object is destroyed and must result in a orphaned error.
It is also illegal to create more than one ext_foreign_toplevel_state_handle_v1 object per toplevel handle instance and must result in a already_constructed error.

interface.name: ext_foreign_toplevel_state_handle_v1

description.summary: toplevel state updates

interface.description:
This object receives events when the state of a toplevel has changed.
This object extends the ext_foreign_toplevel_handle_v1 interface and uses the ext_foreign_toplevel_handle_v1.done event to atomically apply pending state.

enum.name: error

description.summary: ext_foreign_toplevel_state_handle_v1 errors

enum.description: These errors are sent in response to ext_foreign_toplevel_state_handle_v1 requests.

entry.name: orphaned
entry.summary: the ext_foreign_toplevel_handle_v1 was destroyed before this object

enum.name: state

description.summary: types of states on the toplevel

enum.description: The different states that a toplevel may have.

entry.name: always_on_top
entry.summary: the toplevel is always ordered to the top

entry.name: sticky
entry.summary: the toplevel is visible on all workspaces

entry.name: shaded
entry.summary: the toplevel is invisible and represented by a placeholder

request.name: destroy

description.summary: destroy the ext_foreign_toplevel_state_handle_v1 object

request.description:
This request should be used when the client no longer wishes to receive updates to the toplevel state or after the closed event has been received to allow destruction of the object.
See ext_foreign_toplevel_state_v1 for more information about destroying this object.

event.name: state

description.summary: the toplevel state changed

event.description:
This event is emitted once on creation of the ext_foreign_toplevel_state_handle_v1 and again whenever the state of the toplevel changes.
The array contains 32-bit unsigned integers of host endianness that must be interpreted as ext_foreign_toplevel_state_handle_v1.state values.
The configured state must not be applied immediately. See ext_foreign_toplevel_handle_v1.done for details.

event.name: output_enter

description.summary: toplevel entered an output

event.description:
The toplevel has entered the output. Like wl_surface.enter, the toplevel may overlap with zero or more outputs.
The compositor must only send wl_output objects which the client has bound. The compositor must also send this event for every wl_output the client has bound. Clients can filter out wl_output objects which do not belong to the same event queue.
If the ext_foreign_toplevel_handle_v1.finished event was received, then the compositor must not send this event.
The configured state must not be applied immediately. See ext_foreign_toplevel_handle_v1.done for details.

event.name: output_leave

description.summary: toplevel left an output

event.description:
The toplevel has left the output. Like wl_surface.leave, the toplevel may leave the output due to movement, resizing or the output is being destroyed.
The compositor must only send wl_output objects which the client has bound. The compositor must also send this event for every wl_output the client has bound. Clients can filter out wl_output objects which do not belong to the same event queue.
If the ext_foreign_toplevel_handle_v1.finished event was received, then the compositor must not send this event.
The configured state must not be applied immediately. See ext_foreign_toplevel_handle_v1.done for details.

event.name: parent

description.summary: parent change

event.description:
This event is emitted whenever the parent of the toplevel changes. A value of NULL means that there is no parent.
The compositor must only send a ext_foreign_toplevel_handle_v1 object which was created using the same ext_foreign_toplevel_list object as the ext_foreign_toplevel_handle_v1 object this interface extends. No event is emitted when the parent handle is destroyed by the client.
If the ext_foreign_toplevel_handle_v1.finished event was received, then the compositor must not send this event.
The configured state must not be applied immediately. See ext_foreign_toplevel_handle_v1.done for details.

request.name: set_fullscreen

description.summary: request that a toplevel be fullscreened

request.description:
If the compositor honors this request, the ext_foreign_toplevel_state_handle_v1.state and potentially the ext_foreign_toplevel_state_handle_v1.output_enter/output_leave events will be sent.
The output parameter a hint to the compositor and may be ignored. A value of NULL indicates that the compositor should choose the target output, if it honors the fullscreen request.

request.name: set_rectangle

description.summary: designate a rectangle to represent a toplevel

request.description:
If a client using this protocol displays UI elements corresponding to toplevels, it may use this request to inform the server about such a relation. This information may be used by the server, for example as the target for a minimize animation.
If the client sets more than one rectangle, only the most recently set rectangle is considered.
The dimensions are given in surface-local coordinates.
Setting width=height=0 removes the current rectangle if one was set.
